item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 18, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Spaced repetition systems have gotten way better (36 points | 2 comments)
2. Thank you Google for breaking my YouTube addiction (62 points | 33 comments)
3. AniSora: Open-source anime video generation model (258 points | 102 comments)
4. Coding without a laptop: Two weeks with AR glasses and Linux on Android (744 points | 286 comments)
5. Lessons from Mixing Rust and Java: Fast, Safe, and Practical (65 points | 11 comments)
6. Show HN: Turn any workflow diagram into compilable, running and stateful code (66 points | 13 comments)
7. Experts have it easy (2024) (111 points | 36 comments)
8. Mystical (274 points | 34 comments)
9. Project Verona: Fearless Concurrency for Python (95 points | 53 comments)
10. Pglocks.org (72 points | 10 comments)
11. What Every Programmer Should Know About Enumerative Combinatorics (29 points | 15 comments)
12. Directory of MCP Servers (175 points | 59 comments)
13. Push Ifs Up and Fors Down (494 points | 177 comments)
14. ARMv9 Architecture Helps Lift Arm to New Financial Heights (84 points | 40 comments)
15. How to have the browser pick a contrasting color in CSS (207 points | 65 comments)
16. If nothing is curated, how do we find things (251 points | 183 comments)
17. Dead Stars Don’t Radiate (215 points | 109 comments)

20. Mice grow bigger brains when given this stretch of human DNA (46 points | 24 comments)
21. Understanding Transformers via N-gram Statistics (92 points | 7 comments)
22. Mexican Navy ship crashes into Brooklyn Bridge leaving two people dead (88 points | 47 comments)

25. Climbing trees 1: what are decision trees? (29 points | 1 comment)
26. Espanso – Cross-Platform Text Expander Written in Rust (100 points | 23 comments)
27. Bike-mounted sensor could boost the mapping of safe cycling routes (82 points | 43 comments)
28. Internet Phone Book (18 points | 1 comment)
29. FreeBASIC is a free/open source BASIC compiler for Windows DOS and Linux (99 points | 32 comments)
30. Pyrefly: A new type checker and IDE experience for Python (210 points | 131 comments)
